newsitem.title: HUNGARY: SOCCER-HUNGARY SHOW RESPECT FOR IN-FORM NORWAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HUNGARY SHOW RESPECT FOR IN-FORM NORWAY.

text.p: Hungary face Norway in Sunday's
group three World Cup qualifier seemingly prepared to settle for
a draw, although a win would give them a real boost to their
hopes of qualifying for the World Cup finals for the first time
since 1986.
Hungarian coach Janos Csank is aware that the Norwegians,
who lead the group by four points, currently have their tails up
after beating a Brazil side including Ronaldo and Romario 4-2 in
a friendly in Oslo last week.
"The fact that Norway defeated Brazil last Friday is not a
good sign for the Hungarians," Hungarian coach Janos Csank said.
"They have seven or eight players who would be welcome in any
European team."
Despite the Hungarians' defeat in April against the Swiss,
which put Switzerland equal second with Hungary on six points
from four games, Csank has made it clear he would settle for a
draw on Sunday.
"There is no clear favourite for the match, but I believe a
draw is the most probable result," Csank said.
Injury worries over star midfielder Gabor Halmai, from new
Hungarian cup and league double winners MTK, have disappeared
and, with the exception of the Belgian club Anderlecht's
suspended new signing Florian Urban, Csank can count on a full
squad.
The Norwegian squad, which contains eight players who played
this season in the English premier league, also has no injury
problems.
"Despite our victory over Brazil, I consider the match
difficult and very important," manager Egil Olsen said. "We'll
be going all out to overpower the Hungarians, especially in the
air."
